context: Can the Back and Forward buttons be customized to do in-game actions like throwing a grenade?
response: Yes, buttons can be programmed through the LGS software.  Macros can be made with customization timings like delayed key-presses if you'd like as well.  However, to get full macro capabilities, you need to use profiles through the PC, NOT the in-mouse memory profiles.

context: Can you use joystick separate from the throttle?  On some flight sims I just want to use the joystick by itself.  Thanks.
response: Likely no. The joystick plugs in to the throttle with a PS/2 Connector, and the Throttle goes to the PC with USB. I haven't personally tried connecting the throttle to a PS/2 connector on my PC, but I don't imagine it'd work.Not sure why there's not a picture of the connectors on Amazon, but http://www.techwarelabs.com/reviews/peripherals/saitek_x52/images/Complete%20Contents%20saitek%20X52.jpg shows the connector types.

response: Its and awesome game and can be even better with the right specification on a computer. Make sure you have a good graphics card such as Nvidia or AMD, even thought the standard will work, the detail will look better if you buy a graphics card. Also it helps reduce lag during a game.

context: Does your system come with all the cords and controller?
response: YES! It MUST come with controller and all cables. According to the UPC, that is what the system came with so according to Amazon's policy, it MUST come with all those cables and controller. All the people selling them without them are violating Amazon's policy.

context: How is the analog stick sensitivity on this? Does it have any dead zones? Do the buttons feel soft or clicky?
response: The buttons are pretty clicky but the analog sticks do have some dead zone. It's not so much that it gets really annoying but just enough to notice.

context: can the mic be connected to the PC in any way? if so what is the quality?

context: can I use these with xbox one ? someone please answer

context: What kind of game is this?  Is it just for kids?  I'm a 37 year-old male?

Each character has special abilities that you level up as you continue to play. Most of the time I play online against other players. It's a blast even if you're an adult. context: The buttons are already "swapped", or software is required for that?
